item.title: Avowed: Best Blood Magic Build
item.description:
Blood Magic is a skill that lets players use their own health to fuel magical spells in Avowed . It may not seem like much, but since Essence can be difficult to maintain in intense combat situations, having the option to spill blood in exchange for power can be a game changer.

Since Avowed's class system is entirely free-form, players can mix and match skills from different trees to create all sorts of fun playstyles. This one is a battlemage build that revolves around Blood Magic, using both spells and martial prowess to control the battlefield and dominate fights.

Quick Links

  • Avowed: Blood Magic Build Skills
    • Playstyle
    • Stat Distribution
  • Best Weapons and Armor for Blood Magic
  • Best Companions for Blood Magic Build

Avowed: Blood Magic Build Skills

Category

Skill

Fighter

  • Charge (1/3)
  • Barbaric Shout (3/3)
  • Brawn (3/3)

Ranger

  • Critical Strikes (1/3)

Wizard

  • Chill Blades (1/3)
  • Grimoire Mastery (2/3)
  • Returning Storm (2/3)
  • Blood Magic (1/3)

Optional/Late Game Skills

  • Survivalist (Ranger)
  • Secret of Rime (Wizard)
  • Devastating Criticals (Warrior)
  • Evasive (Ranger)
  • Flurry of Blows (Ranger)
  • Quick Switch (Ranger)

Get the main Fighter, Ranger, and Wizard skills listed above first . Spend the rest of the skill points you earn later on optional skills or to upgrade existing ones.

While this build uses both magic and melee, it focuses more on the latter to deal high amounts of sustained damage. Magic here is mostly used for Status Accumulation, mainly for Shock, Freeze, Bleed, and Stun. This is essentially a hybrid version of a two-handed Fighter build, except it involves magic and quick-swapping to account for its lack of AOE and crowd control.

Playstyle

Your main source of damage here is still going to be your two-handed weapon. Use Chill Blades and Returning Storm to initiate a fight and inflict status effects, then charge in with Barbaric Shout and Charge . When the status effects wear off, swap to your Grimoire and cast spells again. Keep in mind that Charge shatters Frozen enemies.

You need to swap and cast spells with your Grimoire if you want to benefit from the +1 Rank bonus it provides for unlocked spells. Also, casting spells this way reduces their cooldowns and Essence/HP Costs.

Stat Distribution

Since Blood Magic uses health to fuel spells, you won't need any Intellect for this build. Focus on getting 10 Might for damage and 8 Constitution for more HP. Then, pump up Perception for bonus critical hit chance, and use items like Painter's Brush for even more crit chance.

Best Weapons and Armor for Blood Magic

Painter's Brush

  • Bitter Bonding
  • Wayfarer's Ring

  • Horsecutter
  • Od Caura's Grimoire Drawn in Winter

If you'd rather have more survivability than crowd control, you can also try using Beothel's Grimoire for Corrosive Siphon and Arcane Veil. Make sure to adjust your skill build accordingly.

Engwithan Cuirass and Bitter Bonding are here to mitigate the health cost of Blood Magic a tiny bit. As long as you're dealing damage, you'll be gaining some of your health back. Barbaric Shout's Temporary Health make sure you're able to recover HP without going down. If you don't have Engwithan Cuirass, stick with Steel Garrote Plate for the damage mitigation.

Horsecutter is a great two-hander for both stunning and inflicting Bleed. When paired with Barbaric Shout, you'll be able to stun most enemies in a single combo. If you're not a fan of two-handed weapons, Drawn in Winter is a great alternative since it can Freeze targets. Otherwise, get Lodestone if you want to stick with stunning enemies.

Od Caura's Grimoire is the preferred tome for this build, mainly because of its CC-heavy repertoire. Chill Blades can Freeze, Resting Storm can Shock and Stun, and if you get Grimoire Mastery 3, Pull of Eora can suspend enemies in a vortex. Use any of these abilities before a fight, then whack your enemies away while they're helpless. Make sure to bring a lot of health items to compensate for Blood Magic.

Best Companions for Blood Magic Build

Giatta is pretty much mandatory when using Blood Magic. She can provide a burst heal and a Temporary Health barrier that also heals once the effect expires. Pair her with Kai, and you'll have a well-rounded team that can deal with any enemy.

If you need more damage, either Marius or Yatzli can fill in for Kai's role. However, you'll want to make sure that your team stays alive and healthy, especially in harder difficulties. Consider getting the Inspiring Triumph skill from the Fighter tree to help keep the team alive.

item.title: Civilization 7: The Unwritten Rules of Achieving an Economic Victory Explained
item.description:
Sprawling 4X strategy games like Civilization 7 throw a lot of complex mechanics at the player, often at the same time. In an average turn of Civ 7 , players are expected to conduct diplomacy with other leaders, command their armies, establish trade routes, research new techs, and make sure all their cities and settlements are operating as efficiently as possible. That's a lot for even the most experienced Civilization fans to keep on top of.

To try and keep these overlapping systems from feeling too overwhelming, Civilization fans have forged a set of natural guidelines over the years. These guidelines are rarely recorded in any official capacity, but they're widely accepted and used nonetheless. Despite its newness, Civilization 7 has plenty of these unwritten rules already, many of which revolve around the game's victory types.

The Unwritten Rules of Getting an Economic Victory in Civilization 7

City and Settlement Placement is Key

The very first thing players are prompted to do at the start of a Civilization 7 match is choose where to place their first city. This decision is incredibly important, especially if players are striving to achieve an Economic victory. Players need to make sure their city is located near resources, and that the tiles surrounding their city synergize with any unique leader bonuses. Placing any subsequent settlements is equally important. To make the process of settlement placement a little more efficient, players can send scouts around the world first to find the most resource-rich locations.

Expand, Expand, Expand

Civilization 7 's Economic victory revolves around gaining resources and connecting them to the rest of the player's empire. The easiest way to collect resources is to have settlements surrounding them. As such, players are heavily encouraged to expand as far as they can, as soon as possible.

This is especially important in Civilization 7 's Exploration Age, when players can journey to the Distant Lands. In this Age, players complete the Economic Legacy Path by sending treasure fleets back to their homeland. In order to unlock these treasure fleets, players first need to establish a settlement located near a treasure, which again encourages players to expand their empire as quickly as possible.

Having a Strong Military Presence Is Helpful

Though the player's main focus should be on gaining resources and establishing trade routes, the road to an Economic victory can be a treacherous one. merchants in the Antiquity Age and treasure fleets in the Exploration Age both need to be escorted to their objectives, and having a sizable army/navy obviously comes in handy here. The player's navy can also steal resources from an opponent's treasure fleet.

Maintain Strong Diplomatic Relationships

Diplomacy plays an important role in the journey towards achieving Civilization 7 's Economic victory. Throughout the Antiquity Age, players will want to make sure they're staying in their opponents' good books, as having a positive relationship with fellow world leaders is necessary for establishing and maintaining a lucrative trade network. Players can also use their Influence resource to use the "Improve Trade Relations" diplomatic action, which permanently increases the number of trade routes between the Civ and the player.

Maintaining strong relationships becomes imperative again in Civilization 7 's Modern Age, as the final objective of the Economic path sees players sending a Great Banker around the world to establish a World Bank Office in every Civ's capital city. Each leader will charge the player to build a bank, and that price changes depending on their relationship.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - How to Get a Gun
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get a Gun in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
  • Where to Buy Guns in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 gives players many weapons to choose from, including melee and ranged. Ranged weapons include bows, crossbows, and even guns, known as handgonnes in the medieval RPG.

Players will have to complete most of the first act before they get access to guns. Handgonnes are powerful when mastered, but players will have to learn how to handle the weapon. Those interested in using them can use this guide to learn how to get guns and use them in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 .

How to Get a Gun in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Henry first gets access to guns in the Finger of God playthrough, although he can learn about gunpowder during the Opus Magnum side quest from the Miller in Lower Semine before that.

Early on in the quest, players will meet up with Godwin at Nebakov to learn how to use handgonnes from one of the bandits at the settlement. Godwin and Hertel will show Henry a "diabolical" invention called a pistole. The pistole is a crude version of a handgun that uses gunpowder to shoot lead balls at targets.

Henry will get a short tutorial from Hertel on how to use it. Then, he and Godwin will get to test them out. The pistole is challenging to aim and slow to load, but it significantly damages its targets when it hits. Follow the below directions to use a gun in KCD2 :

  1. Equip the handgonne from the inventory
  2. Load the weapon by holding down right-click. This will take several seconds, so be careful using guns in fast combat.
  3. Aim the weapon by holding down right-click. Aiming drains significant stamina and gets harder the lower Henry's stamina bar gets.
  4. Left-click to shoot.

Once Henry and Godwin are done practicing shooting, Hertel will give Henry the hand cannon and 20 lead balls for free.

Where to Buy Guns in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Guns are considered advanced technology in KCD2 , so players cannot find them from any merchant. Henry must go to Kuttenberg to purchase other handgonnes and their parts.

Kuttenberg doesn't become available until the second half of the game after Henry reaches a point of no return in the main storyline.

Players can buy other guns and ammo from Gunmaker Prokop Eldris in east Kuttenberg near the Caslavska Gate. Guns range from about 200 to 1200 Groschen, and players can purchase or make their gunpowder using alchemy. Guns, like other weapons, get worn down the more they are used, but they can be repaired at the gunmaker's or fixed by Henry using a gunkit bought from the shop.

item.title: Dota 2 Releases Update 7.38
item.description:
Summary

  • Dota 2's latest 7.38 Gameplay Update deploys a tsunami of changes and improvements to gameplay.
  • The update invites players to explore Wandering Waters, where currents impact traversal.
  • Several updates were also applied to a range of heroes.

Valve has released a February 2025 patch for the MOBA Dota 2 , encouraging players to explore the Wandering Waters in the 7.38 Gameplay Update. Dota 2 fans can utilize currents to arrive in the safe lane with haste within Wandering Waters, and players can also carve out their own destiny through craftable Neutral Items. The update makes several changes and improvements to gameplay, and the community seems very happy with the patch so far.

The multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) was first released in 2013 and serves as a direct sequel to Defense of the Ancients ( DotA ), a community-based mod for Blizzard Entertainment’s Warcraft 3: Reigns of Chaos . Dota 2 is one of the best live-service games on the market, sharing fame with the likes of Final Fantasy 14 , Apex Legends , and Helldivers 2 , and the title also boasts a large esports presence.

Update 7.38 brings revision to major mechanics, as players can now spend skill points on all attributes starting at level 2, reflected spells benefit from all bonuses the original cast had, and slow resistance now increases minimum movement speed by the slow resist percentage. The top and bottom outer rim areas have been flooded by streams in the Wandering Waters update, and watchers, camps, and pathways in the area have been repositioned to accommodate the stream. Roshan counters have to be performed as a team in Dota 2 , and the new update puts Roshan back in the river and will follow the day/night cycle. Additionally, Tormentor spawns have been repositioned to the map corners.

The mammoth update, similar to Dota 2 ’s substantial Crownfall Event update that was released back in April 2024 and included four acts and 24 Treasure sets to name a few features, also included other terrain changes like region-specific map buffs and changes to which sources and targets provide Lifesteal. Furthermore, players can also find Neutral Creep, Item, and Hero updates in the patch.

Dota 2 is also one of the top multiplayer games with the best skins and cosmetics, joining Fortnite , League of Legends , and Fall Guys in the ranking. Customizing heroes with eye-catching skins is one of the perks of the game, but the Dota 2 heroes list also received a substantial update within the recent patch. From Abaddon to Zeus, each hero received improvements regarding Facets, Talents, and Abilities, and these details are designed to tailor a seamless in-game experience while also keeping gameplay engaging for veterans and newcomers.

Dota 2 7.38 Gameplay Update Patch Notes

Major Mechanics

  • Universal Heroes' damage per attribute decreased from 0.7 to 0.45
  • As a result, many heroes have had their Base Damages and attribute gains changed
  • Skill points can now be spent on All Attributes starting at level 2 instead of level 6
  • Reflected spells now benefit from all bonuses the original cast had, including the following:
  • Caster's facet upgrades
  • Bonuses from talents
  • Aghanim's Shard and Aghanim's Scepter upgrades
  • Upgrades used to depend on Aghanim's items the reflecting unit had
  • Slow Resistance now also increases minimum movement speed by the slow resist percentage
  • 20% Slow Resistance increases your minimum movement speed from 100 to 120
  • Glyph of Fortification: Creep duration decreased from 4s to 3s
  • Units no longer gain bonus movement speed during the night
  • Items that have entered a Hero's backpack for the very first time now have a 3 second grace period where they can be swapped into the main inventory without any cooldown. This can only happen once per item per Hero

Wandering Waters

  • The top and bottom outer rim areas are now flooded by streams of traversable water
  • These streams have a current, starting near the T3 towers (right before the medium camp location), down to the T1 towers (former Twin Gate location)
  • Going downstream increases current and max movement speed, while going upstream inflicts no penalty
  • Streams are separated by two zones: ones with a 'strong current' which provides up to 150 bonus movement speed and ones with a 'moderate current' which provides up to 100 bonus speed. The current is 'strong' from stream beginnings near each base up to the waterfalls near T2 towers. All other stream sections are considered to have a 'moderate current'
  • Bonus value depends on the faced direction, ranging from 100% while going downstream to 0% at 90 degrees
  • Watchers, camps and pathways in the areas have been slightly adjusted to give way for the stream
  • Radiant and Dire main jungles now also have a stream with moderate current, starting near the easy camp close to the mid T1 towers. They join the outer streams, crossing the safelane near the T2 towers

Map Objectives

Roshan

  • Roshan is back in the river, with one pit located near each sidelane:
  • Top lair is slightly closer to Dire's jungle entrance, and bottom one is closer to Radiant's
  • Only the active Roshan pit will show as a minimap icon
  • Roshan initially spawns in the Bottom Pit
  • Starting at 15:00, Roshan will follow the day/night cycle, walking across the river towards his designated pit: Top at night and Bottom at day
  • Roshan no longer has bonus movement speed while moving between pits
  • Roshan now has basic 25% Slow Resistance and an additional 25% Slow Resistance when running between pits
  • When running into a hero while moving between pits, Roshan will stop and grab them before violently throwing them away. Upon landing, heroes are stunned for 1s and take 200 pure damage + 0.5% of target's current health per minute of game time. Each time Roshan throws a hero, he gains 70 bonus movement speed and increases throw damage by additional 100 until he reaches his destination pit. After 5 throws Roshan ignores heroes on his way
  • Throw distance: 1500. Max bonus movespeed: 300. Can be blocked by spell-blocking abilities and items, like Linken's Sphere, but can't be reflected. Heroes will be thrown away from Roshan based on their relative position to him
  • Added a Roshan icon near the minimap that shows Roshan's state (alive, dead, maybe alive) and location:
  • If Roshan is dead, the status will also include a timer until his possible respawn
  • Since Roshan's respawn takes between 8 to 11 minutes, during this window the status will say that he may be alive, but also include a timer until the guaranteed respawn
  • If a team gains vision over Roshan or Roshan's Roar of Retribution is heard during this status, the timer will be updated to inform that Roshan is alive
  • Templar Assassin's Third Eye Innate will cause the icon to display exactly when and where Roshan will respawn
  • Roar of Retribution:
  • Now also applies a 2s Disarm on all affected units
  • Radius decreased from 900 to 600
  • Cast point increased from 0.1s to 0.5s
  • Cooldown increased from 20s to 60s
  • Roshan's knockback now has a 2s cooldown before it can be applied to the same unit again
  • Added a unique attack animation for Bash, as well as new animation and particles for Roar of Retribution

Tormentor

  • Tormentor spawns repositioned to the corners of the map
  • There is only a single Tormentor active at a time
  • Tormentor now spawns for the first time at 15:00
  • Tormentor now grants 250 gold to each team member on death
  • Tormentor is also dependent on the day and night cycle, so it's at Radiant side at night and at Dire's side at day. As a result, it will always appear at the Radiant side first
  • Due to this Roshan and Tormentor are always on opposite sides
  • Tormentor's abilities now scale with game time instead of the number of deaths
  • Unyielding Shield: Damage absorb rescaled from 2500 + (200 per death) to 1900 + (20 per minute of game time)
  • Unyielding Shield: Barrier regeneration rescaled from 100 + (100 per death) to 30 + (5 per minute of game time)
  • Reflect: Damage percentage rescaled from 90 + (20 per death) to 50 + (2 per minute of game time)
  • The Shining: Damage per second increased from 30 to 60
  • The Shining: Radius decreased from 1200 to 1000
  • Alleviation: New ability. After dying, the Tormentor leaves behind a 900 radius aura that increases health regeneration of all units in the area by 2% of their Max Health. Lasts 15s

Lotus Pools

  • Changed the way Healing Lotuses are collected from Lotus Pools:
  • Lotus Pools now have three entrances and an empty region in the center
  • Heroes will automatically gather lotuses when within 350 units of the center of a pool as long as they have available space in their inventory
  • The first Lotus takes 1.5s to collect, and each subsequent lotus in a row takes 30% less time
  • The timer only counts down when all heroes within range are on the same team, pausing if an enemy hero enters the area, and resuming when enemies leave
  • If multiple allied heroes are all within range, the Lotus will be granted to a random hero
  • Lotus Pools will now spawn Great Lotuses after Tier 4 Neutral Items are available
  • Lotus Pools will now spawn Greater Lotuses after Tier 5 Neutral Items are available

Shrines of Wisdom

  • Wisdom Runes removed and replaced with new buildings: Shrines of Wisdom
  • Shrines of Wisdom are located in the offlane side jungles between the Tier 1 and 2 towers where the Ancient camps used to be
  • The Shrines will activate every 7 minutes, glowing and filling with experience
  • To gather the experience from an activated Shrine, a hero must stand within 300 units for 3s
  • Like Lotus Pools, the Shrine will not count down time if an enemy hero contests by standing within the effect radius, and will resume only if the enemy hero leaves the area or is killed
  • Experience will be granted to a random hero within 300 units of the Shrine and also to their teammate with the lowest experience

Bounty Runes

  • Spawn interval increased from 3 minutes to 4 minutes
  • Gold provided after the initial set rescaled from 36 + (9 per 5 minutes) to 40 + (6 per 4 minutes)
  • Other Terrain Changes
  • The region specific map buffs (Mighty Mines, etc.) have been removed
  • Corner outposts have been removed
  • The Twin Gates have been repositioned to the corners of the map on a new high ground area near Tormentors
  • Touched up the map in general. Slightly adjusted neutral camps, trees, and cliffs
  • Lifesteal
  • Individual abilities no longer have special rules about how lifesteal works in different situations (heroes vs creeps vs illusions, damage types, etc.). Lifesteal mechanics are now consistent across every ability:
  • Lifesteal applies to physical damage from attacks and is reduced by 40% when damaging non-heroes
  • Spell Lifesteal now applies to physical damage from spells and magical damage from spells or attacks and is reduced by 80% when damaging non-heroes
  • Neither Lifesteal nor Spell Lifesteal applies to pure damage
  • Holding Alt while looking at items that provide Lifesteal or Spell Lifesteal will show the lifesteal percentages for attacking and casting spells, and targeting creeps vs heroes
  • The following sources and targets do not provide any lifesteal
  • Attacks that do not proc Attack Modifiers
  • Attack damage against wards, buildings, or couriers
  • Spell damage against illusions, wards, buildings, or couriers
  • Reflected damage
  • Spells that remove Health instead of dealing direct damage
  • Any damage dealt to self or allies
  • A small number of abilities that do not use Lifesteal or Spell Lifesteal still result in healing and can benefit from Lifesteal Amp:
  • Lifestealer's Open Wounds heals attackers for a percentage of the damage done
  • Lifestealer's Feast heals for a percentage of the target's max health
  • Meepo's Ransack heals all Meepos a flat amount for each strike

Other Terrain Changes

  • The Twin Gates have been repositioned to the corners of the map on a new high ground area near Tormentors
  • Touched up the map in general. Slightly adjusted neutral camps, trees, and cliffs

Lifesteal

  • Individual abilities no longer have special rules about how lifesteal works in different situations (heroes vs creeps vs illusions, damage types, etc.). Lifesteal mechanics are now consistent across every ability:
  • Lifesteal applies to physical damage from attacks and is reduced by 40% when damaging non-heroes
  • Spell Lifesteal now applies to physical damage from spells and magical damage from spells or attacks and is reduced by 80% when damaging non-heroes
  • Neither Lifesteal nor Spell Lifesteal applies to pure damage
  • Holding Alt while looking at items that provide Lifesteal or Spell Lifesteal will show the lifesteal percentages for attacking and casting spells, and targeting creeps vs heroes
  • The following sources and targets do not provide any lifesteal
  • Attacks that do not proc Attack Modifiers
  • Attack damage against wards, buildings, or couriers
  • Spell damage against illusions, wards, buildings, or couriers
  • Reflected damage
  • Spells that remove Health instead of dealing direct damage
  • Any damage dealt to self or allies

  • Lifestealer's Open Wounds heals attackers for a percentage of the damage done

item.title: Avowed: Best Spellblade Build
item.description:
Playstyles that combine might and magic in Avowed offer some of the strongest and most fun experiences you can have in the game. However, with the sheer variety of combinations you can make, getting a build that works can be tricky.

The following is a Spellblade build that combines high damage with excellent crowd control, making it an ideal pick for tackling Avowed's harder difficulty settings. It may take a while before players get all the necessary parts of the build, but even then, it's still strong enough to handle whatever the game throws at you.

Quick Links

  • Avowed: Spellblade Skill Build
    • Stat Distribution
  • Spellblade Weapons and Armor
  • Best Spellblade Build Companion

Avowed: Spellblade Skill Build

Category

Skills

Fighter

  • Devastating Criticals (1/3)

Ranger

  • Evasive (1/3)
  • Finesse (3/3)
  • Critical Strike (1/3)

Wizard

  • Minor Missiles (1/3)
  • Chill Blades (2/3)
  • Grimoire Mastery (1/4)
  • Grimoire Snap (1/3)
  • Harvest Essence (3/3)

Optional/Late Game

  • Flurry of Blows
  • Blizzard
  • Secret of Rime
  • Piercing Thrusts
  • Spirit Lance
  • Quick Switch

This is how your skill trees should like once you hit level 15. Spend the rest of the points you get moving forward to either upgrade the existing skills, or get the ones under Optional/Late Game section.

This build combines agility and wizardry to create a nimble spellblade that uses a one-handed weapon and a Grimoire . Unlike Fighter builds that charge into battle recklessly, this one focuses on Ice spells to Freeze targets before shattering them with Explosive damage , giving the build high DPS potential against both single targets and groups.

Minor Missiles and Chill Blades are your bread-and-butter spells here. Use them to deal burst damage and apply Freeze and Bleed. Once targets are frozen, shatter them with Grimoire Snap (or just hit them repeatedly before they thaw). We'll be using Anextli's Grimoire for this build, which gives us free access to Grimoire Snap and Arcane Veil. You can also get Blizzard or Breath of Frost to freeze multiple enemies at once.

You won't be able to parry enemies while wielding a Grimoire, so you'll need to invest in Evasive so you can dodge more often. Don't worry about being squishy though, as Arcane Veil will handle our defensive needs .

Stat Distribution

For this build, focus on getting 10 Might, 5 Perception, and 5 Intellect as soon as you can, then continue upgrading these stats in this order as you level up. We won't be needing Attack Speed, Stamina, or Health much for this build, so it would be better to focus on boosting damage, crit chance, and total Essence instead.

Spellblade Weapons and Armor

Slot

Equipment

Armor

Arcanist's Gambeson

Gloves

Death Knight Gloves

Boots

Tranton Family Greaves

Amulet

Painter's Brush

Rings

  • Ring of Elemental Balance
  • Ring of Pain Amplification

Weapons

  • Last Light of Day / Anextli's Grimoire
  • Drawn in Winter / Aurochs-Skin Grimoire

You can get Last Light of Day, Arcanist's Gambeson, Anextli's Grimoire, and Drawn in Winter very early on, but the rest might take a while. Use whatever other pieces of gear you have until then, just make sure to upgrade your weapons along the way.

Anextli's Grimoire will be your main spellbook for this build since it gives you early access to Grimoire Snap and Arcane Veil. Later on, you can swap this for something like Aurochs-Skin Grimoire, which has Blast of Frost and Freezing Pillar. Make sure to have at least one point in Grimoire Snap if you plan on changing spellbooks.

If you're unable to freeze enemies in a single hit of Chill Blades, use Drawn in Winter as your main weapon. Otherwise, use Last Light of Day so you can build Fire Accumulation and regenerate HP with every kill.

Best Spellblade Build Companion

Among Avowed's cast of companions, Marius is the best one to have if you're playing as a spellcaster of any sort. This is thanks to his Binding Roots ability , which can Root multiple enemies at once. Apart from controlling enemies, this skill will also let targets take more damage from persistent effects like Blizzard, improving your overall freeze rate.

Kai is a great secondary companion if you're struggling with enemy aggro, but if you can handle the heat, then either Yatzli or Giatta will do just fine.
